Award.AbstractNarration:
The Noncommutative Geometry Festival 2019 will be held at Washington University in St. Louis from April 29th to May 3rd. This year, the theme of the festival is Noncommutative Geometry and Representation Theory.

The goals of the festival are to highlight some of the most significant recent advances in noncommutative geometry, identify promising new research directions, and acquaint graduate students and postdocs with the most current research in the field. This year, topics will include index theory, hypoelliptic operators, representation theory, and more. More information about the conference can be found in the following website https://sites.google.com/site/ncgwustl/.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
We  supported the following conference during the period of 04/29/2019- 05/03/2019, “Noncommutative Geometry Festival 2019”. The week long workshop at St. Louis was a part of the annual Workshop in the area of non-commutative geometry. It provided an opportunity for young researchers in noncommutative geometry to share their ideas with peers and with some of the leaders of the field. The theme of the workshop was noncommutative geometry and representation theory.  There were over 46 participants of this conference from all of the world, among which there were 34 junior researchers. 23 world leading mathematicians spoke in our conference highlighting the connection between  noncommutative geometry and representation theory. The conference was full of inspiring talks. Totally, there were over 30 U.S. based participants attending this conference. We used this NSF grant to support 30 U.S. based participants focusing on junior researchers, underrepresented groups, and mathematicians without federal support. 

 

 

In the conference at St Louis, leading experts in  noncommutative geometry and representation theory met and discussed the recent developments in noncommutative geometry. There were many inspiring talks, and enlightening discussions about the recent achievements and furture directions. The outcomes of the conference shall shed light on the future developments in hypoelliptic operators, representation theory and noncommutative geometry.
